level.heading: PETITIONS FOR INTERPRETATION OR ENFORCEMENT OF AGREEMENTS APPROVED PURSUANT TO7 U.S.C. ยง 252(E) (ยง 15-2622)

level.text: Any telecommunications carrier, including the incumbent local exchange carrier, may file with the Commission a petition requesting interpretation or enforcement of an agreement approved pursuant to 47 U.S.C. ยง 252(e) of the Telecommunications Act, D.C. Code, 2001 Ed. ยง 34-2002(h), and these rules.
An original and fifteen (15) copies of the interpretation or enforcement petition shall be filed with the Office of the Commission Secretary.
All interpretation or enforcement petitions filed with the Commission shall be signed by a duly authorized representative of the petitioning carrier and shall include:
The name, address, and main telephone number of the petitioning carrier;

The name, title, business address, telephone number, fax number, and e-mail address (if available) of the person(s) who will be representing the petitioning carrier during the interpretation or enforcement proceeding;
A complete list of all telecommunications carriers that are parties to the approved agreement;
A statement of the disputed issues that give rise to the interpretation or enforcement petition;
A statement outlining the positions of each party to the approved agreement regarding the disputed issues;
All relevant documentation that supports the petitioning carrier’s position concerning the disputed issues; and
A statement as to whether the petitioning carrier requests an evidentiary hearing.
The only parties to the interpretation or enforcement proceeding shall be the parties to the approved agreement.
Any petitioning carrier shall serve a copy of the interpretation or enforcement petition and any supporting documentation on all other parties to the approved agreement.
